boardgame.name: Die Seher von Santiiba
boardgame.description:
In the far reaches of Santiiba, the Valley of the Hopeful, seers ply their occult trades.

Each turn in Die Seher von Santiiba, one player rolls the five dice, which correspond with five kinds of cards. The dice have 1-3 stars on three of the sides and the numbers 4-6 on the other three sides. Each other player then secretly selects a color, whether the color they think you'll choose or the color they themselves are interested in. You then name one of the colors, and if anyone else has selected that color, they reveal this information. If the matching die shows stars, they move their seer figure on the scoring track this many spaces, and if it shows a number, they take a card of this color. You either take the die (if it shows stars) or the card, placing this object in your "area of uncertainty". You then continue your turn by naming another color or end your turn.

If no one choose your named color, then you pick either the die or card of this color, placing the object in your area of uncertainty. If you took a card when the die showed stars or took a die with a number, then you must continue your turn; otherwise, you can choose to continue or end your turn.

If all other players have revealed their color choices, then you lose everything in your area of uncertainty, receiving only a bowl card as consolation. If you end your turn — whether voluntarily or after successfully choosing four of the five colors — then you move all the cards to your oracle board and advance your seer a number of spaces equal to the sum of all the dice.

Players take turns in this manner until the first player reaches 30 VPs. Only then are the victory points on the cards counted as well — but the player who has collected the fewest cards of any particular sort won't get to count the neighboring kind of cards at all. If you have the fewest herbs, for example, then your amulets are worth nothing. Ties are broken in favor of whoever has the most bowl cards. Once you've determined which cards (if any) you must lose, you sum the value of your remaining cards and advance your seer. All players who reach the Cloud Castle of Wisdom on space 75 win; otherwise, whoever has advanced the farthest wins.

boardgame.name: Wings of War WWI: RAF R.E.8
boardgame.description:
The RAF R.E.8, introduced in early 1917, was the long–awaited replacement for the Be2 series of recon airplanes, offering greater speed and strength. Initial reactions were mixed, as the R.E.8 required more pilot attention than the Be2 and early accidents of spinning and stalls resulted. Once overcome, the airplane became the standard for British observation and light bombing, serving through the end of the war. It was nicknamed “Harry Tate,” after a cockney comedian, who pronounced his name “AIR–EE.”

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – RAF R.E.8
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Wings of War: Deluxe Set

boardgame.name: Piggy Forest
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time there was a Wolf trying to catch three little pigs without any luck. That's a well known story from the past, and now the wolves and the pigs compete every year in an annual houses build & demolition festival in the wood of Piggy Forest!

Piggy Forest is a collaborative card game where the players must build houses of different materials (straw, wood and stone) inside of which they must later place the pigs (not three like the original story but nine). Three different wolves will appear destroying the houses, so the players must play together by exchanging building materials and characters from their hands. Other special characters called "protectors" also appear (they will help to win the game).

This is a card game for family, kids and friends, with solo play system and 9 extra ways to play!

Will you miss this exciting battle? The Piggy Forest Team vs The Wolf Gang!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Little Pigs

boardgame.name: Ricochet: A la poursuite du Comte courant
boardgame.description:
Ricochet is a solo or coop game, including a serie of riddle to solve, associating ideas.
The 30 riddles are linked in a crazy secret agents story: everytime, you have to find the last sentence of a dialog.
To find the missing sentence, the player must hide 20 to 22 words from a grid containing 25 words. The remaining, read in the rignt order and out loud give a hearing rebus wich is the dialog last sentence.

boardgame.name: Welcome to La Petite Mort
boardgame.description:
A Deadly Crossover!

Welcome to La Petite Mort is a unique crossover expansion that works both for Welcome to... and La Petite Mort - le Jeu.

Set in the dark humour universe of the French comic book "La Petite Mort" by Davy Mourier, players will act as the Reaper's son, who has been ordered to wipe the population of your neighborhood.

This expansion can be played with both games independently (you do not need to own both) with the same components.

Played with Welcome to..., this expansion asks the players to reap the souls of the inhabitants using a particular type of death (drowning in pools, car crash in parks,...) corresponding to the different actions of the game. Faster paced than the original and more streamlined, the expansion changes substantially the original gameplay.

Played with La Petite Mort, this expansion asks the players to reach new objectives for their Diploma as the Grim Reaper.They will have to make sure old people are "collected" and avoid the new and young residents, much harder to collect. Adding a new "write" mechanism to the original game, the expansion drastically changes the way the cards are played.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Living in the After of Azothog
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throw your players into a post-apocalypse where the world has fallen to the alien entity known as Azothog.
Before Azothog's arrival, the characters are approached by Doctor Attar Singh, who asks them to help him save humanity. After hiding in an underground bunker for several months, this adventure begins with the character's re-emergence into the world. What horrors await in this Lovecraftian inspired adventure?

This adventure is designed for quick character creation and gameplay. It enables deep investment and immersion through character background hooks that tie directly into the story.

This publication includes:

A compelling storyline with detailed park locations and events.
Full character creation and gameplay rules that can be used for your own one-shot adventures (based on D100).
Character sheets, NPC and villain statistics
Maps & visual aids.


This adventure is perfect for a one-off session, convention play, or integration into a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: The Last Reichsritter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Storm the beaches of Normandy during World War II. The characters are a part of Operation Caliban, a top-secret mission to destroy a supernatural creature that the Nazi's call the Reichsritter.

The players can trade in swords and spells for a Bren-gun or M1 Garand. The characters can be members of the American, United Kingdom, Canadian, or another allied military. They can also be part of the French Resistance or operatives of the Office of Special Services (OSS) or the Joint Intelligence Committee (JIC).

This adventure is designed for quick character creation and gameplay. It enables deep investment and immersion through compelling events and NPCs.

This publication includes:

A compelling storyline with exciting combat and tough calls.
Full character creation and gameplay rules that can be used for your own One-Shot adventures.
Character sheets, NPC, vehicle and villain statistics
WW2 Weapons & Equipment stats (with pictures)
Maps & Visual aids.


This adventure is perfect for a one-off session, convention play, or integration into a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: Clowns of Funland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Immerse your players in a horror movie where their characters are the victims!

Searching for a missing family member, the characters are drawn to a mysteriously abandoned amusement park. They soon discover they're not alone after encountering a mysterious cult of clowns, anxious for the characters to join them in the revelries.

This adventure is designed for quick character creation and gameplay. It enables deep investment and immersion through character background hooks that tie directly into the story.

This publication includes:

A compelling storyline with detailed park locations and events.
Full character creation and gameplay rules that can be used for your own one-shot adventures.
Character sheets, NPC and villain statistics
Maps & Visual aids.


This adventure is perfect for a one-off session, convention play, or integration into a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: Inglenook's Lesser-Used Spells: Spells of Wind and Weather
Inglenook's Spells of Wind and Weather
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition, featuring 16 new spells relating to weather effects.

Make more use of the weather rules: curse mighty giants to blow away in the breeze, read your spellbook in the middle of a typhoon, and awe your enemies with dramatically-appropriate supernatural weather. This tome-ette contains spells for the humble peasant and the dread champion of darkness alike, making it a perfect gift for births, weddings, feastday celebrations, and prostrating in dread before the diabolical conquerors of your once-peaceful realm.

boardgame.name: Inglenook's Lesser-Used Spells: False Friends
Inglenook's Spells: False Friends
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for Pathfinder 1st edition, featuring 30 new spells. While not particularly serious, the spells are designed to be usable in play - this isn't a joke product.

Have you been mis-sold magical incantations, scrolls, spellbooks or eldritch initiations into blasphemous rites? Embarrass yourself with belated, public realisations that you learned the wrong spell? Avoid the pitfalls of overeagerness, scrawly handwriting and gullibility with this handy guide to spells that aren't the spell you're actually looking for. Thirty misleading spells, often silly, but some of them potentially useful nonetheless. When you need to temporarily hide a servant, lecture the undead or slightly alter your trousers, this is the place to look.

boardgame.name: Hell Prisons
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Welcome to an infernal dungeon run by fiends!

The devils are trying to tip the scales of the Blood War by establishing soul conversion facilities. These terrifying prisons are used to torment souls with an intention of creating more powerful devils and filling the battlegrounds of Avernus with powerful soldiers. Only brave adventurers can disrupt this horrifying scheme.

The supplement includes:

• Lore about how hell prisons are established and function.

• Advice for the Dungeon Master how to run adventures within a hell prison, including a ready made 3-level dungeon for characters level 5-10.

• 19 detailed chambers for use in the hell prison or to be dropped into existing dungeons.

• 3 new monsters - Hell Warden, Infernal Cook and a Steam Elemental.

If you are curious about the quality of the product, check out the free supplement - The Abbot Reimagined.

boardgame.name: To Kill a Star (Starfinder)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Empire Must Fall
The legions of the Ultari Hegemony have been turned back once again, their parade of victories turned to rout, but even now their rulers plot revenge from their long-hidden sanctuary in the deeps of space. Their ruin never will be complete unless their stronghold is overthrown, and the heroes must pursue their fleeing leaders beyond the boundaries of known space and through an endless nebula where dead gods drift and living entropy reigns through a rip in the fabric of reality to find a vast realm left behind by an elder race, where magic, mighty machines, and the power of the mind rule all. Here a corrupted sun is caught in the grip of an impossibly vast sphere spanning hundreds of millions of miles, joined by an intricate network and dominated by the collective psychic power of countless minds. Breaching this shell, the heroes face technological terrors and wonders in equal measure, guarded by the souls of the damned and the scions of the sun, and infiltrating a thought-controlled bureaucracy to find long-lost friends, unlikely allies, and an end to immortality itself. To shatter the power of the Hegemony and bring peace to the galaxy, they must shatter the chains of destiny and unleash a power beyond imagining To Kill a Star!

To Kill a Star is an adventure for 19th to 20th-level characters using the Starfinder Roleplaying Game. This is the double-sized final chapter in the amazing Legendary Planet Adventure Path, a spectacular sword-and-planet saga from Legendary Games blending sci-fi and fantasy, magic and machines with an exciting pulp sensibility and style. To Kill a Star includes not only a massive interstellar adventure but also brand-new monsters, magic, and technology, including rules for explosives and heavy weapons, a full gazetteer of a star-spanning Dyson sphere and its inhabitants, and an ongoing fiction series. Here you will find amazing adventures that span the stars and plunder the planets in a campaign that takes your heroes to 20th level and beyond! Grab this exotic epic today and Make Your Game Legendary!

This 148-page PDF or 146-page print volume contains the following:

• "To Kill a Star," a Starfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 19th to 20th-level characters by Jason Nelson and Steven T. Helt.
• A "Planetary Bestiary" by Mike Welham and Steven T. Helt, featuring 12 new monsters: the void-blasted locusdaemon, the gleaming diamantem, the psychic erebus, the deadly griever cyborb and annihilator and myrmidon robots, the kaulvrex hive, the savage pelkrev, the ghostly yllosan, and spacefaring amorphs like the living nebula, star blight, and supermassive singularity!
• New technological and magical items like the klaven spacesuit and black ray pistol!
• A detailed gazetteer of the massive Dyson sphere that encompasses the entire star.
• Expanded rules for adventuring in the void, including dealing with gravity, radiation, vacuum, zero-gravity maneuvering, and more!
• “Planet Killer,” the final chapter in Chris A. Jackson’s ongoing tale of Anasya, an interplanetary adventurer just hoping to survive the literal end of the world!

boardgame.name: Death in Freeport: 20th Anniversary Edition (Fantasy AGE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

20 years ago, Green Ronin made a name for itself with Death in Freeport, a d20 System adventure released at GenCon the same day as the 3E PHB. It went on to win the very first ENnie Award and the Origins Award for Best RPG Adventure. Return to those halcyon days with this 20th Anniversary Edition of Death in Freeport, now updated to the Fantasy AGE rules!

Chris Pramas—the designer of the AD&D Guide to Hell, WFRP 2E, and Dragon Age—created the city of Freeport for this classic adventure for low-level characters. Add urban sprawl, pirates, and a touch of cosmic horror to your campaign with the City of Adventure.

Death in Freeport has already kicked off thousands of campaigns. Be part of the legend with the 20th Anniversary Edition!

boardgame.name: Bloodsuckers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of level 8

The Countess Carmilla Mora died as she lived: as subject of rumor and scandal. Her decadent parties were legend, her conquests numerous, and her predilection for nocturnal rendezvous an open secret.

When her loyal retainers announced her passing away from a “disease of the blood,” gossip in the vicinity of Castle Mora ran rampant.

Then, creatures of the night began lurking about her crypt, and the market price for garlic skyrocketed. And as travelers across Mora County took to carrying sharpened stakes and holy water, vampire hunters began arriving in droves.

boardgame.name: Men in Tanks: Lazarus' War
boardgame.description:
Lazarus Croft, the dictator of Arcadia reigns over four nations, but now he’s lying on his deathbed with no son behind. Therefore, He orders a dramatic battle among the four generals. The One who captures the flag will win the throne and complete power over the whole empire. The battle takes place at Cloverfield, a place covered by dangerous rocks, deep blue lakes and grassy fields.

This game is a free-for-all match, but it can be played in 2V2 team formation too. There’s no elimination and there’s always a chance to win. Players can only make actions during their own turn. Everyone starts with an equal gold supply that can be used to buy new items, units or actions. Players can progress by performing actions on the battlefield with their units.

What can be an action?

moving on the board
shooting other units
building new objects
exploring secret rocks
upgrading a unit in the field


Furthermore, there are quick operations that cost no action.

Any action can only be executed by soldiers. Each unit has its own skills. Soldiers can drive vehicles, shoot or build new objects for instance. The truck can carry two soldiers and move faster. The tank is a real bulldozer with explosive shot and long shooting range. And the specialist is a real jolly-joker with different skills in each unit. The battlefield is totally random and destructible with almost infinite possible interactions between different units.

How the number of actions is decided?
An action mode has to be selected at the very beginning of the game; this mechanics determines how the available actions are defined.
- In Dice mode available actions are rolled by the dice in each turn. This is a quick and simple simulation with no hesitation, no hard decisions, but the importance of luck is present.
- In Card mode available actions are chosen from hand. It’s all about strategy and serious decisions with little or zero effect of luck on the gameplay.
Action modes define several interesting mechanisms such as Action buy, Redistribution or Alternative win.

Men in Tanks comes with 2 game modes by default; Deathmatch and Capture the Flag, but 5 additional ones may come as stretch goals! They are; Full Army, Plunder, The Commander, 4 Flags and Battle Royale.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tibushi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

FSpaceRPG Far Frontiers Tibushi is an abbreviated world supplement for a startup ranching outpost world in the Meshan Cluster Drift region on the frontiers of Terran space. Adapted from the generic version written by Philip Warnes.

Plenty of adventure options on the surface of this hostile world terrestrial like world are available, whether helping with ranching constructions, hunting safaris or exploration. An orbital way station is under construction and serves as a means of connecting worlds in the Drift for small starships plying the spaceplanes in the region.

It contains a full colour world map of the main world, details of the characteristics of the world, its general history and a background on the dangerous flora and fauna for you to expand into your own campaign.

This supplement is written specifically for FSpaceRPG, but can be adapted to other systems without the aid of the generic product version od this supplement.

boardgame.name: Dark Horrors & Hidden Places: OSR Dark Gothic Horror Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is the year 1884. Many places sunk beneath the earth after a worldwide tremor. Strange creatures spill forth onto the streets of towns and cities, as governments struggle to keep these monstrosities a secret. The lawful and wealthy hire the bold and adventurous to fix their issues and recover their possessions from places of wonder and danger, unseen but for myths and legends. Worlds have collided and adventure awaits the brave.

Imagine mixing the worlds of Jack the Ripper, H.P. Lovecraft, Hammer Horror, and old science-fiction fantasy movies like Journey to the Center of the Earth in this OSR roleplaying game of dark gothic horror, featuring:

Five character classes: Arcanists, Brutes, Engineers, Pistoleers, and Scoundrels.
List of arcane spells and a random table to create new ones.
Simplfied OSR rules relying mostly on roll-over attribute checks and attack rolls.
Mundane and exotic weapons, plus a random table to create new ones
Horrific beasts, adjustably dangerous by increasing level
Includes an adventure and an exotic locale with unknown dangers to face.

boardgame.name: Adventurous Archetypes: Tarot Archetypes Volume I - The Fool and The Magician
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Turn of a Friendly Card

Great adventurers deserve great options, and the most dangerous quests sometimes require the most specialized of training. The Adventurous Archetypes books each provide a handful of character archetypes tied to a specific theme, inspired by one of Paizo’s adventure paths. Although these archetypes are thematically linked to that campaign, and the topics on which it focuses, they are just as suitable for characters whose players wish to explore those themes as well, or even for GMs who are looking for inspiration and new abilities to give to monsters and NPCs.

This installment of Adventurous Archetypes focuses on the power of the tarot, a deck of cards commonly used for divination. While tarot in the real world is just for fun, in fantasy settings, such means of divination can potentially grant great insight, and of all the tarot cards, the Major Arcana are the most evocative in the imagination, drawing on the power of archetypes such as The Magician, The Lovers, and Death. Now your character has a chance to harness the power of these archetypes, taking on their strengths and talents. This book presents archetypes for two such tarot cards: The Fool, whose luck and sincerity somehow always see him through the dangers his naiveté gets him into, and The Magician, the master of magic and illusion, whose deceptive misdirection allows her to constantly outwit her foes.

boardgame.name: Ecology of the Umbral Elves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“When our eyes adapted to the inky darkness, we saw what lay hidden in the shadows. This realm was a sick reflection of ours, empty and truly terrifying. A world like our own, but formed of shadow, pale and devoid of soul. There were shadow-creatures that took the form of men. Undead huddled in the corners of the darkness, waiting for those who would enter or open the gates to the shadow realm. Rivers of pure shadow flowed across the soulless landscape. We have been there and back again and the travels have left their marks. Do not fear my pallor, for to us it is a badge of honor, it reminds of where we have been and what we have lost. We will be your guides and protectors.”
–Umbral Elf Ranger

The Northmen speak of dusky elves who are born of the shadows, tireless hunters of the Dark Ones. They sweep out of the forests and mercilessly eradicate the Dark Ones wherever they are found. Despite their hatred for the evil shadowfolk, they seem to be dispassionate towards the mortal men and women of the north. They call themselves umbral elves, but many call them wraithe elves, and their true history is tangled in antiquity.

Within this PDF:

The complete playable race of the Umbral Elves
New advancement feats
Umbral Elf background tables
boardgame.rpgseries: Ecology of the... (Total Party Kill Games)

boardgame.name: Celestial Prayers: New Cleric-Specific Spells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Heroism is not just defeating the enemy but is the willingness to sacrifice oneself for those under our aegis.”
— Romenis Dowermin, Archbishop of Davalon

The following are new cleric-specific spells that your divine caster can call upon during their adventures and sacred trials.

This supplement includes:

5 new cleric-specific spells

boardgame.name: Frag doch mal… die Maus!
boardgame.description: Movie
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2008 German Developer Award Best German Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: The Dark Eye: Conspiracy at Ferdok
Das schwarze Auge: Verschwörung in Ferdok
boardgame.description: RPG
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2008 German Developer Award Best German Browser Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Gothic 3: The Beginning
boardgame.description: The action takes place 140 years before the events in the first Gothic game, on the island of Khorinis. Xardas (one of the main characters from the original PC Gothic series), an orphan, raised by farmers, is visited one night by the ghost of Buthomar. The ghost tells the young Xardas about an unknown threat and asks him to find "the other four Chosen Ones".
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2008 German Developer Award Best German Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: The Settlers: Awakening of Cultures
The Settlers: Rise of Cultures
Die Siedler: Aufbruch der Kulturen
boardgame.description: Rise of Cultures
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2008 German Developer Award Best German Strategy Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Runes of Magic - Chapter 2: The Elven Prophecy
Runes of Magic - Chapter II: The Elven Prophecy
boardgame.description:
one of the main elements of “Chapter II – The Elven Prophecy” will be the introduction of the Elves as a playable race. Coming along with a huge new background story, new regions and many new quests.

According to the legends, demons of human origin – having degenerated into underworld beings under the influence of the runes – forged an alliance with the nagas in ancient times. Together, these evil forces brought war and devastation to the world of Taborea. An alliance of elves and humans succeeded in banishing the demons into the void and drove back the nagas behind a magical wall called the Great Barrier. However, when elven prince "Sig'aylas" removed the holy sword "Arclight" from the wall to defend his human true-love, the wall perished and the Naga threat flared up once again.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2009 German Developer Award Best PC Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Winter Sports 2011
WinterSports 2011
boardgame.description: Strap on those ski boots, put on the ski glasses and make sure the scarf is where it's supposed to be.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2010 German Developer Award Best Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Galaxy Racers
boardgame.description: Cartoon
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2010 German Developer Award Best Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Runes of Magic - Chapter 3: The Elder Kingdoms
Runes of Magic - Chapter III: The Elder Kingdoms
boardgame.description: The history of the old kingdoms of Runes of Magic is told in Chapter III through many new quests. Level 55 and above adventurers will become familiar with a new skill system where they can select from a pool of special abilities.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2010 German Developer Award Best Online Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Best 11 Board Game: Juventus
boardgame.description:
The first official Juventus football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Il primo gioco in scatola tutto calcistico ufficiale della Juventus!
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Best 11 Board Game: Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Best 11 Board Game: Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio

boardgame.name: Under Illefarn Anew: Fallen Kingdoms of the Shining Vale
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

N5: Under Illefarn campaign book set in the Forgotten Realms, during the era described in the original Forgotten Realms boxed set (the “old gray box”). It was one of the first adventures published for the Realms, and, as such, remains a fan favorite more than 30 years after its publication.

This unofficial revision of the module is an update that attempts to stay true to the original module, while updating the game mechanics to Dungeons & Dragons (3.5 Edition), the history to reflect stories uncovered in countless other game products (including A Grand History of the Realms, City of Splendors: Waterdeep, Dragons of Faerûn, FR11 – Dwarves Deep, Lost Empires of Faerûn, Serpent Kingdoms, and Volo’s Guide to the Sword Coast, among others), and the story to fill in a backstory that ties the events more strongly into the Realms.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 24
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Space Port Chatter 12
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So the explorers are hanging out at a busy space port… most likely one of the seedier bars… and they hear a bunch of chatter around them. Some things are day to day conversation, while other bits of audible noise could be clues or potential adventure hooks. This chart provides the GM the advantage of being able to roll the percentile dice and come back with a snippet of dialogue should a character want to make a listen check.

boardgame.name: 100 1970s Era Bystanders 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 1960s Era Bystanders 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 1960s Era Bystanders 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent (and not so innocent) bystanders that are perfect for adding to your retro rpg campaign. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V16.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: Balthoka Coldlands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Steam boils up from the ground as your ship touches down. You begin clicking through the post landing sequences as you notice environmental readout warnings pop up on of the cockpit’s monitors. Warning: Freezing nighttime temperatures and below average to freezing day temperatures. Low to medium toxicity levels detected in air from pollen clouds.
Great… you hate the cold and you have allergies… where in the galaxy do you find a planet that has both perpetual cold temperatures and a never ending blooming cycle of large flowering plants!?! Here, apparently.
Sighing in disgust you reach over for your helmet. You were hoping that you could ditch your hazard protection suit for a change and just get some fresh air...

This role playing game supplement contains an overland hex map of a chilly but flowering planetary region that is suitable for star faring campaign settings. The map has varying geographic hues and the detailed entries describe a world that is very exotic and sometimes unforgiving. Each hex on the map represents 10 kilometers and there are 16 numbered areas on the map total. Each of the numbered areas contains details that help the Game Master (GM) plot out a potential adventure, dangerous encounter, or friendly settlement or space port. The GM is welcome to further add on to the location with additional encounters, events, or important locations if they so wish.

After the main page you will find a bonus encounter chart. The GM should use this chart any time the characters are exploring unmarked locations on the map and the action is starting to get dull.

Two additional versions of the map are provided. One version lacks the numbered locations and the descriptions, giving the GM something to print if they wish to present to the player characters. The characters can use this map to keep track of where they have been and where they might be going (or wishing to explore). The second version adds extra blank marker circles (in a pinkish tone) to allow the GM to add some of their own points of interest to the map.

The detailed map entries are written in a manner that allows the product to be as game system/edition generic as possible. The flavor is that of typical space opera variety, allowing you to add or remove as much of a “space fantasy” flavor as you need. As discussed prior, all the important bits are kept to one sheet of paper, allowing you to print off only that if you wish and also allowing you to quickly reference locations without having to flip through a bunch of pages.

boardgame.name: 100 Seedy Starport Encounters 14
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wandering through the streets, crowded hallways, and cramped businesses of dirty, seedy starports are an endless variety of encounters. Some are travelers from distant worlds while others are natives. This list provides a name for each encounter as well as a role and brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Roaring Twenties Bystanders 14
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different innocent(?) bystanders that are perfect for a Roaring Twenties rpg campaign setting. Included in each entry is a first and last name, gender, age, and role/occupation.

boardgame.name: Alignment and Personality
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Alignment is regarded by some as a moral compass - it directs your beliefs and actions along an often fairly narrow, axis, good vs evil being one such axis, with lawfulness vs chaotic being another. Some others think it is a broad way of looking at a characters personality.

This PDF gives you a system for determining the characters alignment/personality, with 10,000 possible options.

The results gained may at first glance seem odd, even contradictory, but they can represent “both sides of the same coin”. People are complex organisms and few of them should be just one aspect , such as their their outlook or personality, made manifest.

boardgame.name: Blood Moon Ritual Site
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The dreary forested woodlands gives way to a large ravine where bloody waters meet after rush down the rocky cliff side meeting a muddy bank full of bones. Thick vines have grown around rocks creating a small bridge to the other side where a path leads towards a small altar. The altar is surrounded by two other small streams and sits at the highest point on the rock it was built on.

Below the altar are five trinkets made from skulls and carved wood corresponding to the four large obelisks that surround the area as well as the shrine itself where magical energy swirl and pulsates with power. Within this opening in the wilds you can marvel at the stars which shine above.

Adventure Seed

A great curse has been unleashed on the kingdom of man, its epicenter within the lands of the forestfolk. Once-blue skies are ashen and pristine waters run red...

When you track down the source, you find an entity with ram horns crowning an eyeless face, its mouth twisted in a smile of white teeth like shards of broken bone.

What’s happening? When the king of the forestfolk died, preparations were made to crown his eldest son king. However his younger son disputed the elder one’s claim, and the argument resulted in the youth being banished from the tribe.

When the day came for the ceremony, the five village wisemen convened in the sacred grove with the first born son. They began the ritual passed down from generation to generation, painting his face with hues of ocher, reciting ancient words of their people.

Unfortunately this was interrupted by a band of unrecognized men-at-arms, lead by the exiled son. The ritual stopped, the wise men pleaded with the impostor to not spill blood in this holiest of places, for the consequences would be dire.

Unbeknownst to all parties involved, the reason this place was considered holy was because it shared a particular affinity for the outer planes. Spilling blood here would open a portal to those realms.

Disregarding their wisdom, the younger son killed his brother, and as his blood ran into the rivers, the sky darkened and a large figure with reddish skin and horns appeared in front of the altar...

boardgame.name: Moonlit Town Wall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mist swirls among the tall redwood trees, as the moon rises high in the sky. The thick moss that grows here, gives off an earthy smell and sprawls across the forest floor towards the dirt trade roads, where caravans pass everyday, creating rutted grooves in the muddy roads.

Small wooden palisades surround the road and at the end a large stone wall blocks your entry into the town, small lanterns swaying gently in the breeze.

boardgame.name: Fortified Town Wall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Birds tweet and bicker among the tall redwood trees, as rabbits dart in and out of the burrows they’ve dug by the roots. The thick moss that grows here, gives off an earthy smell and sprawls across the forest floor towards the dirt trade roads, where caravans pass everyday, creating rutted grooves in the muddy roads.

Small wooden palisades surround the road and at the end a large stone wall blocks your entry into the town.

boardgame.name: Attacked Town Wall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Birds tweet and bicker among the tall redwood trees, as rabbits dart in and out of the burrows they’ve dug by the roots. The thick moss that grows here, gives off an earthy smell and sprawls across the forest floor towards the dirt trade roads, where caravans pass everyday, creating rutted grooves in the muddy roads.

Small wooden palisades surround the road where bloodied bodies lie and at the end a large stone wall blocks your entry into the town.

boardgame.name: Attacked Moonlit Town Wall
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mist swirls among the tall redwood trees, as the moon rises high in the sky. The thick moss that grows here, gives off an earthy smell and sprawls across the forest floor towards the dirt trade roads, where caravans pass everyday, creating rutted grooves in the muddy roads.

Small wooden palisades surround the road where bloodied bodies lie and at the end a large stone wall blocks your entry into the town, small lanterns swaying gently in the breeze.

boardgame.name: Ruined Workshop Docks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stone rails have been made rumble while wooden struts and slats lie broken, damaged by the bombardment that hit the port. Dried blood covers the ground but bodies are no where to be seen.

Cranes that were used to off-load goods hang over the railings. Crates and barrels have been damaged and In the center of the dock, below the rails are tarps and rubble.

boardgame.name: Oriental Townsfolk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 24 png. files of characters from farmers and children to nobles and merchants.

Each file is 480 x 480 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: Dark Menagerie 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This set contains 20 characters being set 2 of creatures inspired by a popular "witch/monster" hunting series.

Each file is from 480 x 480 to 980 x 980 pixels and 150 dpi.

boardgame.name: The Black Wyrm of Brandonsford
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's a dragon in the woods.

Those friendly dwarves were the first to go, the poor things. And now the beast has been killing and eating the people of Brandonsford. No-one wants to leave the town's walls. With the humans out of the forest, fairies have taken over, and now the goblin king Hogboon seeks to claim the entire forest as his new kingdom.

The Black Wyrm of Brandonsford is an old-school compatible module for characters level 1-3, in which they visit the colorful inhabitants of Brandonsford, adventure through the fairy-haunted woods outside the town, delve into two dungeon locations, and hopefully, slay a dragon.

boardgame.name: The Knight Line (Issue 1 & 2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is The Knight Line?

The Knight Line is a bimonthly collection of stories, adventures, and usable game material for both The Polyhedral Knights' titles and other games you might like to play. Each issue aims to bring some content for a new game and genre, but fantasy is our mainstay and there is always at least one fantasy article or piece of content.

boardgame.name: The Camlann Chronicles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Camlann Chronicles is a Welsh and Brythonic themed campaign for both 5th edition and the Lore 100 System.

King Aedan is a broad-shouldered man in his early twenties. His loosely fitting tunic depicts a white bear on a field of royal blue; a sword hangs at his side. For nearly a year now, King Aedan has worn an unkempt beard and a distant look of sadness that came upon him after the death of his father, King Uther. You vividly remember the announcement of King Uther’s death as it echoed off the walls and corridors of Castle Camlann, “The King is dead; long live the King!”

The Camlann Chronicles weaves together Arthurian legends and fantasy RPG tropes. Fledgling kingdoms, including the likes of Gwynedd, Rheged and Dyfed, fight amongst themselves for control of the mythic British Isle. The nobility of these fledgling kingdoms share the common dream of a united realm; though they are unwilling to bend their own knee.

In this campaign, the struggle to unite the kingdoms of the British isle is primarily a fight between two human kingdoms, Gwynedd, in the South, and Moray, in the North. Gwynedd is the kingdom ruled by the hand of the righteous King Aeden; it is backed by the Fey, or Elves of Avalon. Moray is a Pictish kingdom ruled by the battle-hardened King Ungus, and backed by the Seelie, the exiled elves who were wrongfully cast into the darkness of Underearth by the Fey. If the Fey and their allies are champions of chivalry and the light, then the Seelie and their allies are believers of liberation theology and are quite comfortable lurking in the dark.

This book contains:

4 full scenarios; 12+ game sessions
10 pre-generated player characters
Settings section for a fantastical rendering of Welsh and Brythonic Britain
Description of important NPCs
Designed for 5e gameplay, with optional rules for incorporating character background
Includes the Lore 100 RPG system

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Juventus
boardgame.description:
The most famous board game in the world is enriched with this edition dedicated to the famous Juve team of Turin.
Build your empire and amass fortunes, but beware of taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

boardgame.name: Tannsowan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A class most wicked for MÖRK BORG.

Are you ready for the Tannsowan? Are you ready to rip the teeth from the mouths of fallen monsters? And finally are you ready to plant them into the ground and grow your own skeleton army?

Then look no further. For the Tannsowan is here!

boardgame.name: Fulhurst Moors 2.0 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dreary village of Fulhurst Moors, most residents spend their days cutting peat from the nearby bogs or tending ﬂocks of rugged sheep on the moor. When night falls, the villagers huddle in their homes or gather inside the solid stone walls of the Bell and Whistles. Here they trade stories of the latest gruesome misfortunes to befall those foolish enough to venture out onto the moor after sunset or unfortunate enough to be caught by sudden fog or rain while working in the bogs.

The local priest has been driven close to madness by his inability to provide solace to his congregation, and the mayor and constable become increasingly concerned as a growing number of villagers drown their fears in moonshine whiskey. The fearful atmosphere is well deserved, for ancient beings of malice and cruelty haunt the mists beyond the village. And they have struck a terrible bargain with someone inside Fulhurst Moors.

boardgame.name: Fulhurst Moors 2.0 (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dreary village of Fulhurst Moors, most residents spend their days cutting peat from the nearby bogs or tending ﬂocks of rugged sheep on the moor. When night falls, the villagers huddle in their homes or gather inside the solid stone walls of the Bell and Whistles. Here they trade stories of the latest gruesome misfortunes to befall those foolish enough to venture out onto the moor after sunset or unfortunate enough to be caught by sudden fog or rain while working in the bogs.

The local priest has been driven close to madness by his inability to provide solace to his congregation, and the mayor and constable become increasingly concerned as a growing number of villagers drown their fears in moonshine whiskey. The fearful atmosphere is well deserved, for ancient beings of malice and cruelty haunt the mists beyond the village. And they have struck a terrible bargain with someone inside Fulhurst Moors.

boardgame.name: Fulhurst Moors 2.0 (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When night falls, the villagers huddle in their homes or gather inside the solid stone walls of the Bell and Whistles. Here they trade stories of the latest gruesome misfortunes to befall those foolish enough to venture out onto the moor after sunset or unfortunate enough to be caught by sudden fog or rain while working in the bogs.

The local priest has been driven close to madness by his inability to provide solace to his congregation, and the mayor and constable become increasingly concerned as a growing number of villagers drown their fears in moonshine whiskey. The fearful atmosphere is well deserved, for ancient beings of malice and cruelty haunt the mists beyond the village. And they have struck a terrible bargain with someone inside Fulhurst Moors.

boardgame.name: Fulhurst Moors 2.0 (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dreary village of Fulhurst Moors, most residents spend their days cutting peat from the nearby bogs or tending ﬂocks of rugged sheep on the moor. When night falls, the villagers huddle in their homes or gather inside the solid stone walls of the Bell and Whistles. Here they trade stories of the latest gruesome misfortunes to befall those foolish enough to venture out onto the moor after sunset or unfortunate enough to be caught by sudden fog or rain while working in the bogs.

The local priest has been driven close to madness by his inability to provide solace to his congregation, and the mayor and constable become increasingly concerned as a growing number of villagers drown their fears in moonshine whiskey. The fearful atmosphere is well deserved, for ancient beings of malice and cruelty haunt the mists beyond the village. And they have struck a terrible bargain with someone inside Fulhurst Moors.

boardgame.name: Through the Mountain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The wizard voiced his objections, but in the end we had no other choice: the deserted dwarven halls offered the swiftest and safest way to the other side of the mountain range. We knew it would be dangerous, that we would have to open the gates sealed against the long-ago gnoll invasion. Folk still whisper of cannibal gnolls trapped forever in the dark. Others say there are worse things to be found: giant centipedes, portalweb spiders. The wizard brushed aside these concerns, though. He seems to fear something worse still...

This is a large scale, system-agnostic dungeon crawl designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a dwarven or gnoll settlement, a random wilderness encounter, or a challenge between your party and their objective.

boardgame.name: UFOs: Ships of the Reticulan Empire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weather balloons. Swamp gas. Low-flying planes. We have all heard the excuses given by government suits, news hacks, and close-lipped military officers. But the truth, as they say – is out there. For decades, maybe centuries – even millennia – they have visited us. Short, thin gray beings bent on exploring – or maybe conquering and exploiting – Terra. They pilot starships that are technologically advanced beyond anything Humanity had in the 20th and 21st centuries: archetypically saucer-shaped but there are other shapes as well. Terrans designate these ships as "Unidentified Flying Objects" – or UFOs. This supplement allows you to combine such advanced alien craft, as well as their Reticulan crews, into your science-fiction role-playing campaign.

We present you with eight UFO designs based on classic Reticulan spacecraft shapes from UFO lore. They come complete with high-resolution deck plans, color renders, and full game stats for the Cepheus Engine We also provide rules for generating Reticulan characters, as well as a general description of the Reticulan species. We also provide several Cepheus Engine variant rules appropriate for the starships included in this booklet.

The background for this booklet is, by default, Stellagama Publishing's These Stars Are Ours! space-opera setting for the Cepheus Engine. However, we designed the booklet so that everything is readily and directly useable in any science-fiction setting envisioned by the Cepheus Engine™ SRD, Cepheus Light, and similar OGL 2D6 Sci-Fi games.

However, These Stars Are Ours! presents significantly more information regarding Reticulans, as well as more Reticulan character generation options. We highly recommend that any Referee or player interested in Gray Aliens, or the default detailed background behind these UFOs, refer to this book.

For the sake of completeness, we have also included three ships originally presented in These Stars Are Ours! – the Abductor, the Civilian Saucer, and the Military Saucer.

boardgame.name: Savage Roles: The Guardian
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creating a Savage Worlds characters can be a daunting task for both new and veteran players. Players often look for guidance on creating a character with a specific function in their party.
This product introduces two concepts to facilitate that need: Role and Class. A Role provides instructions on how to build a character to fulfill a broad function on the battlefield. If you are looking for further specialization, a Class builds upon the foundation of a Role. Classes provide a more specific vision of how a character performs their chosen function.

This supplement introduces the Guardian Role and the subsequent Bastion and Shieldbearer Classes. Guardians stand in the way of harm, drawing the fire of their enemies. They absorb punishment meant for their allies and keep the fight in front of them, right where they like it. If you enjoy playing a character who takes the strongest shots from an enemy and stands firm, the Guardian is for you. Although they have a fantasy setting feel, they can easily be adapted for use in other settings.

Includes:

30+ New Edges
1 Role
2 Classes
Advice on how to build a character for all included Roles & Classes

boardgame.name: The Mythic World of Oldskull Book I: Oldskull Warriors
Oldskull Warriors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wonderland Imprints is proud to present the first volume in the Mythic World of Oldskull series, providing the advanced modular rules developed for author Kent David Kelly’s epic campaign adventure game. These volumes are designed to integrate perfectly with one another if you collect them all, or to stand alone if you prefer to pick and choose aspects from the Oldskull campaign that you’re personally intrigued by. If you’re looking for universal and directly compatible old school materials to bridge the original game editions created by Arneson and Gygax (1974-1985), Holmes (1977), Moldvay and Cook (1981), Mentzer (1983-1986), and other luminaries of TSR (1974-1989) into a single refined system, you’ve come to the right place.

This detailed volume features the fully refined and corrected classes of the warrior archetype: the doughty Fighter (with clarified rules for weapon specialization), the revised Oldskull Barbarian, the intrepid Hunter, and the deadly Ranger of Queen’s Cambria. All classes have been fully integrated with world mythology, folklore, weird fiction, and detailed campaign notes from the author’s campaign that will bring your warrior characters alive in the World of Oldskull. All of the classes and rules have been reimagined and updated throughout with extensive sagely advice along with out-of-print magazine and newszine errata, supplemented by notes and musings derived from E. Gary Gygax in accordance with his vision for his never-attained Advanced Second Edition.

Twenty of the new elements and systems you will find herein include: extensive themes and evocative level titles for all classes, social standing guidelines by level, freehold guidelines for fighter lords, fighter command ranks, fighter morale and loyalty effects on soldiers, corrected and more intuitive weapon specialization, jumping rules, non-thief climbing rules, rebalanced barbarian role-playing guidelines, 11 iconic Oldskull barbarian tribes (the Amazons, Cimmerians, Stygians, etc.), full barbarian skills based on Gygax’s hunter notes, snare setting rules, wound binding rules, full hunter skills, beast mastery rules, spirit hounds for high-level hunters, free-from-problematic-IP background lore for the ranger class, fully corrected and justified ranger spell casting rules for druidic and magical powers, corrected tracking rules (following from the Unearthed paradigm), and rebalanced and fairer thematic disadvantages for the ranger class.

boardgame.name: The Garden of The End
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

John McBrian is an archeologist that has recently discovered gigantic ruins underneath some hills in Morocco. John doesn’t want to make this discovery public yet to avoid unnecessary crowds around the place, so he invited his old friends, the main characters, to help him explore the place and make a complete analysis of the ruins. So why is your character important to the exploration in hands?

The Garden of The End is a cosmic horror / investigation one page adventure, which means it’s an adventure made for Role-Playing Games (RPG) that is entirely written in one page. To play you’ll need an investigative RPG system, a player to be the Game Master (GM) and 2 to 5 players to roleplay the Playable Characters (PC).

boardgame.name: Renaissance+ Tool Box
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Renaissance+ Tool Box brings 'Blood Games 4' into the past! Filled with new PC species, Paths of Power, Normal Template Trees, Bestiary, and a new way of creating Chimeras, the Renaissance+ Toolbox lets you kit out a whole new time period!

boardgame.name: Arms of the Seelie Host
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Forgotten Treasury! Here we reveal some great new magical items, fit around a theme, that could well add some fun and diversity to your Pathfinder 1e experience!

Ancient tales, spread through oral tradition, tell of a long-lost conflict before the Age of Man. Ancient armies of the Fae walked the mortal realm, doing battle with monstrous hordes, and other hosts like themselves, all in a bid to rule the Seelie Kingdom. This book details some awesome treasures and left-over trinkets that could add some spice to your game.

boardgame.name: Dima's Ascent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dima's Ascent takes its name from Dima Mahkas, the adventurer and explorer who first mapped the region years ago, and the densely forested, rising terrain that leads to the mountainous slopes to the south and east. Traveling through the area is challenging. Several trails lead into the forest, but they all fade to nothing beneath the thick canopy. Foresters, hunters, and trade guilds have attempted to blaze trails through the woods, but guides get lost, blazes disappear, and markers move or vanish. There are two permanent campsites in Dima's Ascent, Mahkas Hill Camp and Two Peaks Camp, but getting to them is difficult. A more substantial campsite on the west edge of the forest, Shade, serves as a jumping-off point for travelers. Those heading east who are lucky enough to stumble upon Lake Greenwood can usually reach the mountains beyond the Ascent by following the lake's shore. Some visitors try to find the Pierced Stone, a massive boulder with a 10-foot wide natural hole through its center. Others seek out the Faelight Grotto, a small natural cave filled with magical glowing lights.

boardgame.name: Mad Science in Sunderland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This third-level adventure takes place in the Sunderland town of Leacher’s Vale, an unassuming settlement of rough but amiable people. Brewing beneath its streets is a scientist seeking to unlock the powers of tissue regeneration. This madman is nearing a breakthrough, but at a terrible cost. The heroes arrive in town helping an eccentric inventor find the source of bomb-making materials used in a recent attack, but soon must scour the sewers for the laboratory and end the reanimation sequence.

This adventure follows the Trouble in Grassy Spur adventure, and is part of the larger Savig's Salvation adventure path. Character should reach fifth level by the end of this adventure.

boardgame.name: Heroes of Terra: Player's Guide to the Mushroom War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter a world of floral sorcery and saurian savagery! Welcome to Terra, a parallel universe where magic lives, and the dinosaurs thrived and evolved into new species. Humans never emerged on Terra—instead, the world is dominated by floral life and saurians.

Heroes of Terra is a pulp-fantasy setting for Savage Worlds Adventure Edition, equal parts sword & sorcery epic, and classic video game homage. Jump high, grow huge, and break open chests! Terra needs heroes!

This is the Player's Guide for the Heroes of Terra: The Mushroom War setting. This pdf contains everything a player needs to make a character for the world of Terra.

boardgame.name: Hunters in Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hunters in Death is designed for low level play using any "Old School Renaissance" compatible game system. As such, don't expect much by way of balance. This sage advice was once overheard in a local watering hole in Hounds Head: "A wiser fella than myself once said, sometimes you eat the bear....sometimes the bear, well, he eats you."

Hunters in Death is set in the Komor Forest. A place that's consumed civilizations and birthed abominations. Yet there is a single outpost, Hounds Head, that holds back the darkness. It's a beacon for adventurers. Silver and blood are promised. And delivered. Some adventurers return with sacks overflowing with coins and jewels, but most fertilize the forest with their blood.

Adventure is only a rumor away at the tavern, a trusting resident's plea for help, or by striking out into the forest to explore the many ancient ruins. There is no path to follow, no road less traveled. Forge your own path with steel and magic. Nature does not negotiate.

boardgame.name: Codex Miscellaneorum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Codex Miscellaneorum is a collection of player options designed to bring new stories and genres your 5e OGL campaign. Within these pages you will find:

New Classes and Subclasses for Fantasy, Horror & Modern play
Six New Races including Catfolk, Werewolves, Undead & More
New Magic Items
A complete set of 5e compatible Psionics rules
Ballistics rules for 5e

boardgame.name: Sectors Fifty-Five - Fifty-Nine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sectors Fifty-Five to Fifty-Nine in "Deep Space" are filled with conflict. All five of the "Deep Space" species have outposts in these sectors, and the threat of violence is always there. Plus, there are numerous mysteries to be solved by intrepid explorers.
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Juventus – Bite Size
boardgame.description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit.
600 questions about the world of Juventus Football Club.
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty!
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box.
Test your knowledge of the following topics:

Coaches,
League,
Curiosities,
Players,
International Matches,
Victories.


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit.
600 domande sul mondo della Juventus Football Club.
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti!
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare.
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti:

Allenatori,
Campionato,
Curiosità ,
Giocatori,
Partite Internazionali,
Vittorie.

boardgame.name: Rest In Peace
boardgame.description:
For more than a century, two families of ghosts have been fighting each other to control the greatest mansions of the land. Claim manors and castles by sending your most frightening ghosts, and put an end to this endless war by outguessing the other family.

Rest In Peace is a two-player game in which you play a family of ghosts composed of 21 cards (from 1 to 6). Each round, you will be fighting for a mansion, trying to outbid your opponent. Managing your hand will be critical and knowing when to withdraw from a fight might lead you to the final victory.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 2 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
REST IN PEACE Seit über einem Jahrhundert kämpfen zwei Geisterfamilien um die Kontrolle der größten Herrenhäuser im Land. Schicke deine erschreckendsten Geister in Herrenhäuser und Schlösser um sie für dich zu beanspruchen und beende die Fehde unter den Gesiterfamilien indem die deinen Kontrahenten überlistest.
Rest in Peace ist ein 2-Personen-Spiel in dem du eine aus 21 Karten (von 1 bis 6) bestehende Geisterfamilie spielst. Jede Runde versuchst du deinen Kontrahenten zu überbieten um so die Vorherrschaft über einem Herrenhaus zu erlangen. Dabei ist es besonders wichtig den größten Nutzen aus deinen Handkarten zu ziehen. Zu wissen wann man sich aus einem Kampf zurückziehen muss, kann zum erringen des finalen Sieges führen.
Inhalt: 42 Geisterkarten 29 Hellseherkarten 1 Spezial-Hellseherkarte 10 Wohnsitz Chips 2 Spielhilfen
https://youtu.be/numa6h100Sg
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Athletic Club Bilbao
boardgame.description:
Monopoly Rojiblanco - Athletic Club Bilbao
Lezama (Training HQ), San Mamés (stadium), the titles ... everything has its price.

Una edición exclusiva de Monopoly que incluye características diferenciadoras de las versiones normales del juego, como las casillas, que en vez de calles son momentos históricos y lugares emblemáticos del equipo rojiblanco como San Mamés, Lezama, la primera Liga, el equipo femenino, etc. Asímismo, las casas y hoteles se convierten ahora en gradas y estadios.

Las casillas 'Paseo del Prado' y 'Paseo de la Castellana', las más caras en la versión tradicional son aquí el escudo actual (400M) y la bandera (350M), las más baratas, justamente, el primer emblema e imagen del club rojiblanco.

boardgame.name: Best 11 Board Game: Inter
boardgame.description:
BEST 11 is an official F.C.Internazionale product: an exciting board game during which the participants will have to try to put their very personal Inter line-up into play by choosing the most suitable module and coach, complete the San Siro stadium, recover the economic resources necessary for the management of the company , take advantage of the events in their favor and challenge each other in search of a goal that could change the fate of the game.


BEST 11 è un prodotto ufficiale F.C. Internazionale: un board game avvincente durante il quale i partecipanti dovranno cercare di mettere in gioco una loro personalissima formazione dell’Inter scegliendo il modulo e l’allenatore più adatto, completare lo stadio di San Siro, recuperare le risorse economiche necessarie alla gestione della società, sfruttare gli avvenimenti a proprio favore e sfidarsi alla ricerca di un gol che potrebbe cambiare le sorti della partita.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Best 11 Board Game: Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: BEST 11 Board Game – Il Gioco dei Campioni
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Best 11 Board Game: Atalanta Bergamasca Calcio

boardgame.name: The Polka-Dot Game
boardgame.description:
The game is played on an 8x8 checkerboard of white and light grey squares.

Pieces consist of Dots in 8 colors - Pink, Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Indigo, Turquoise, and Purple. There are 8 Dots for each color, for a total of 64 pieces.

The two players divide up the Dots however they like so that one player has all of 4 colors, and the other player has all of the of the other 4 colors.

Players take turns placing a Dot on any empty space on the board - with the following restriction: a Dot may not be placed on any square that shares the same row, column, or diagonal of a Dot of the same color.

First player unable to place a Dot on their turn loses.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Everbane
boardgame.description:
Everbane is a role playing card game for 2 to 6 players where each player takes on the role of an epic hero in a cold and unforgiving world . Each hero is battling to be the most notorious hero in the land. Accomplish the most dangerous quests and be the first to get 10 prestige points to win the game. Trick your opponents, steal their loot, duel them & send monster on them. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversary.

ACCOMPLISH EPIC QUESTS

Draw a card from the quest pile and reveal it to the other players. Compete with other heroes to be the first to finish the quest. Each accomplished quest will give you prestige points. Be the first to get 10 and become Everbane’s most notorious hero !

TREACHERY & CUNNING

Duel your opponents, steal their card, unleash monsters against them and force them to trade their cards with you. Use any means necessary to take advantage of your adversaries.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Aggretsuko: The Short Timer Strikes Back
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A match-three game based on the TV and Netflix series Aggretsuko. The titular red panda has been tasked by her tyrannical boss to decorate the various floors of the new office building.

To do so you must earn her "stars" by completing levels of match-three puzzles. Each level has differently coloured tiles (modeled after the characters in the series), plus office-themed obstacles that require special criteria to be removed. The goal is to remove the obstacles and clear the level in a set number of moves.

Along the way you unlock the various characters, which each have special abilities. You also unlock the one-minute episodes of the Aggressive Retsuko TV series.

The game contains two types of currency, which are available for in-app purchase.

boardgame.name: Commotion
boardgame.description:
"The Fun, Fast, and Frantic Word Game!"

Players draw a card to determine a random secret. They give give a one-word clues to help other players guess the secret word. If someone does, the guesser and clue giver both score points. When someone reaches 9 points, there is a showdown where that player has a chance to win the game.

The original game was released in 1990. In 2020, a limited number of copies were re-released as the 30th Anniversary Edition, apparently using components discovered in storage from the original game. All copies of the new edition are signed by Edward Carter.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Inter
boardgame.description:
The most famous board game in the world is enriched with this edition dedicated to the famous Internazionale team of Milan.
Build your empire and amass fortunes, but beware of taxes, jail and bankruptcy.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Inter – Bite Size
boardgame.description:
Pocket version of the world famous Trivial Pursuit.
600 questions about the world of Inter Milan Football Club.
Some of these questions will put even the most experienced fans in difficulty!
The game does not require any board and can be carried in its convenient triangular box.
Test your knowledge of the following topics:

Coaches,
League,
Curiosities,
Players,
International Matches,
Victories.


Versione Tascabile del Famosissimo Trivial Pursuit.
600 domande sul mondo del Inter Milano Football Club.
Alcune di queste domande metteranno in difficoltà persino i tifosi più esperti!
Il gioco non richiede alcun tabellone e può essere trasportato nella sua comoda confezione triangolare.
Metti alla prova la tua conoscenza dei seguenti argomenti:

Allenatori,
Campionato,
Curiosità ,
Giocatori,
Partite Internazionali,
Vittorie.

boardgame.name: Cohorts & Cronies
boardgame.description:
Cohorts & Cronies is a chaotic 2-4 player death match. Players assume the role of a Champion and build strategies to destroy one another on an ever-changing battlefield, using Champion-specific abilities and attacks, spells, traps, walls, towers, and of course, Cohorts & Cronies!

Players choose a random battlefield, gather resources, and fight to the bittersweet end. Use cards to call forth armies from different worlds, cast a dazzling array of magicks, and build all manner of defenses (warning: some defenses may be offensive). Finish your turn by uniting with your Cohorts & Cronies to launch devastating strikes against your opponents!

Throughout the battle, players will draw cards from the Event Deck in addition to their Champion's deck. The Event Deck is filled with Monsters, Gear, Merchants, Hazards, drastic Weather changes and Dimension Rifts to keep the chaos flowing. Within this deck also lurks the dreaded BOSS, smashing into the fray to attempt to kill all Champions. Nobody can win if the BOSS is alive.

This is an intricate, chaotic strategy game made for teens and adults with a love for complex mechanics, inappropriate jokes, and roguelike replayability. There are no duplicate cards; choose wisely!

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Borussia Mönchengladbach
boardgame.description:
Trivial Pursuit, Borussia Mönchengladbach Edition

A game board, 100 cards with questions and answers
1 die, 6 knowledge stores and 36 colored knowledge corners
600 questions about Borussia Mönchengladbach


Trivial Pursuit in der Borussia Mönchengladbach Edition

Ein Spielbrett, 100 Karten mit Fragen und Antworten,
1 Würfel, 6 Wissensspeicher und 36 farbige Wissensecken
600 Fragen rund um Borussia Mönchengladbach

boardgame.name: Victory at Sea: Merchant Convoy
boardgame.description:
Preventing attacks on defenceless merchant ships is the other main role of the navy, and it was her that the war was fought, day in and day out, by the humble corvette, frigate and destroyer escort, and later by escort carriers. Commerce raiding formed a critical part of the strategy for several nations – Germany’s Kriegsmarine almost brought Britain to her knees whilst the US Navy similarly strangled Japan’s movement of industrial goods, materials, troops and supplies.

Grouping ships into convoys meant there was more expanse of empty ocean out there – hopefully raiders would not even find the convoy. It also made escorts more effective, but in the event a convoy was hit by a surface raider, such as a heavy cruiser or battlecruiser, the target would be devastated in short order. Nevertheless, the convoy system helped a great deal. It would fall to the escorting ships to defend them until either a heavy covering force could come up in support or the merchants could make their escape. Some of the most heroic, and worst mismatched, actions of the war took place in defence of merchants convoys or troop ships.

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Victory at Sea: Battle for the Pacific

boardgame.name: Cutthroat Island Dueling Pirates
boardgame.description:
Bury your treasure or duel other pirates during your turn. Be sneaky and cunning just don't get caught or you'll pay the price! Cutthroat Island Dueling Pirates is a card plus dice game. The pirate that finds and holds on to the most treasure wins!

Each pirate is dealt 4 cards and given one 6 sided die. The remaining cards will are placed in the middle of the table to create the draw pile. Pirates have two choices during their turn. 1) they can bury treasure or 2) they can duel another pirate. Buried treasure comes in $1, $2, or $3 cards. When a pirate chooses to duel another pirate each pirate will roll their dice to see who is victorious. To the victor goes the spoils, one treasure card is randomly chosen from the losing pirate's treasure pile.

Your turn ends after you have played your card and be sure to draw back up to 4 cards. In addition to dueling and treasure cards, there are special cards that make the game even more fun and unpredictable.

How good of a pirate are you? Cheating is not only allowed but encouraged! Just don't get caught. Any pirate that catches another pirate cheating can take one treasure card from their pile. The game ends when the draw pile is gone, which signals the last round of play. The pirate with the most treasure wins that round and collects one gold coin. Play a quick 10 minute round or multiple rounds and see who is the best pirate!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: ポーション (Potion)
boardgame.description:
In potion, each player get cards with objectives on them. They will then try to fill a pot with the amount of leaves and cubes needed and take that pot when it's done.

There are two catches, though.
They need to take care of not overflowing the pot with ingredients or else, they will get no point for there objectives.
Also, they need to remember what other players put inside those pots which are not translucent.

boardgame.name: Tater Freighter
boardgame.description:
Will you be the master of the Tater Freighter? The baron of the Jam Tram? The captain of the Shrimp Blimp? Or will you skip out and just Tater Later?

In Tater Freighter, players try to outwit their opponents using their vehicles to swipe the most food. The person with the most food at the end of five rounds wins.

Players take turns simultaneously. Each Round:

New food is revealed
Players choose a vehicle secretly, planning and bluffing their opponents to claim the available food.
Players reveal and resolve their vehicles. Food is claimed in ascending order.
Players collect claimed food. If multiple players choose the same vehicles the food splits. If it can't split, it remains for other players to claim.
Once all claimed food is collected, the next round begins.


At the end of five rounds, players score their earned points for the sets of food you've collected. The player with the most food wins.

Tater Freighter is easy to learn. Remember this rules rhyme and you are ready to play:

Place Eight Crates.
Reveal a Vehicle.
Lines Split Limes,
Planes Split Grains,
Blimps Split Shrimps,
Trams Split Jams,
Freighters Split Taters,
Or Later Tater!
Split or they sit.
Fill bins to Win.


—description from the publisher

A roleplaying game adventure module and resource for use with any roleplaying game. In a quasi-medieval setting, Broken Castle is an original roleplaying campaign that was played with public participants in 2006.

The second battalion of the 503rd Airborne Infantry, part of the famous 173rd ABN Brigade, attacked up a narrow ridge towards the top of hill 875. The NVA had planned the battle for weeks...they were waiting.
330 Americans will face the entire 174th NVA regiment.

The core rulebook for the Numa RPG where you play young samurai frogs.

boardgame.name: Double or Nothing
boardgame.description:
Double or Nothing is an anime inspired three player roleplaying game that creates episodic, over the top buddy cop action-comedy stories. It’s primarily inspired by Dirty Pair, but has elements of Gunsmith Cats and a wide variety of odd duo action movies from the 1980s.
Oh, and you should only play it if the three people involved are comfortable with flirting with one another. Actually, it’ll probably work best if you’re eager to do that.

Reimraupe is a German memo game with rhymes.
Reimraupe ist ein Memospiel mit Reimen.

https://youtu.be/8gxMduiFBCs
